Experience Human Resources Intel Corporation Human Resources Intel Corporation Human Resources Intel Corporation

Summary Talented, results-producing Human Resources Professional with over 20 years of accomplishments in planning and leading comprehensive Human Resources strategies in support of business goals and objectives. Strong generalist skills in all functional areas of Human Resources, with expertise in leading HR programs in support of mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, integration of subsidiaries and movement of businesses into other areas of the company. Can create and implement unique HR practices for adjacent and start up businesses within a large company.  
 
Demonstrated experience leading cross-functional and global teams to drive projects. Able to work with technical teams on implementing strong program management competencies such as setting clear goals and rallying teams to those goals, removing collaboration barriers and implementing workforce planning strategies. Lead teams through organizational re-design to assessing existing talent to developing new competencies and skills.  
 
Strong consulting and influencing skills; ability to think strategically. Utilizes networks and strong business acumen to quickly build trust with clients for effective partnership. Flexible in style and approach to work varying discipline and with varying levels of personality styles. Thrives in ambiguity and has the ability to turn chaos into manageability.  
 
Is a trusted consultant and team-player by using HR analytics and data to support opinions and recommendations. Experience Human Resources Business Transformation Consultant Intel Corporation January 2000  – Present (15 years 8 months) Folsom, California Deliver innovative, strategy aligned solutions that produce measurable business results and shape Intel for the future.  
 
Work across multiple business groups within Intel on projects such as: Workforce Planning Strategies, Integration of Acquisitions, Corporate Culture Change initiatives, Change and Transition Management and Leadership Coaching.  
 
Responsible for partnering with the customer to strategically integrate effective HR processes, programs and practices into their daily operations. Conduct needs assessments or audits and make recommendations or proposals, coordinate the creation and implementation of an action or corrective plan, and when required, organize and coordinate cross-functional Human Resource teams to assist with developing and implementing performance improvement corrective plans, programs or processes. Manager Human Resources Intel Corporation January 2000  – Present (15 years 8 months) Director, Human Resources Intel Corporation January 2013  –  March 2014  (1 year 3 months) Santa Clara, California Led Human Resources for a software services business that was formed from external Media talent and grew to over 400 employees within 2 years. Set up unique HR systems for external hiring of key industry talent, onboarding, culture creation of start-up like communications and employee engagement within a large company. Utilized prior divestiture experience and playbook for successful divestiture of the business to another company; ensuring retention strategies were in place through coaching leadership how to lead through ambiguity. Led HR team to support the business through the change, including complex compensation re-design into new company. Human Resources Manager (Divestitures, Starting up new companies) Intel Corporation August 2006  –  December 2012  (6 years 5 months) Folsom, California Managed and led all Human Resource activity for merger of a new company, Care Innovations (a joint venture between Intel and GE Home Health). Researched and implemented Professional Employer Organization (PEO) to contract all HR services for company. Designed and communicated new Compensation and Benefit plans as well as set up company policies. Worked with executive leaders on Change and Transition Management, culture alignment with the two companies and organizational design and selection of employees for the new company.  
 
HRM for Flash Memory Group (7500 worldwide employees). Coach business with organizational design and structure, business acquisitions, and integration programs. Lead workforce planning systems, performance management processes & employee relations through data analysis and recommendations. Manage HR specialist team. Led employee due diligence in divestiture of business with ST Microelectronics to form a new World Wide Flash Memory company.  
 
Remained at Intel to be the HR Manager for the Non-volatile memory solution business and partnered closely with the VP and Controller, focusing on hiring and acquiring key talent, leadership development and enlisting employee ideas on how to improve efficiency and time to market for business profitability. Senior Human Resources Business Partner Intel Corporation 2000  –  2006  (6 years) Folsom, California Designed and implemented HR services for businesses in the areas of compensation and performance management systems, succession planning and workforce development strategies. Experience solving employee relation issues from workers compensation to harassment cases. Created diversity hiring and retention strategies, including training and education for employees on the business case for diversity. Manager Human Resources Level One Communications 1995  –  2000  (5 years) Sacramento, California Area Responsible for development and implementation of corporate human resources workplace strategies and programs for World-Wide Sales and Marketing, Information Technology, Finance & Administration. Partner with senior management to develop programs that attract, retain and motivate employees. Facilitate organizational change and integration of new companies.  
 
Coordinate campus recruiting and Internship program; Recruit candidates for Engineering, Sales & Marketing, IT, Product Test, Quality & Reliability, administrative and technical positions. Responsible for coordinating company advertising program, career fairs and other recruiting events.  
 
Research, recommend and manage competitive benefits programs for an organization of 700 employees, including stock incentive programs. Implement Wellness Programs to include a Health & Safety Fair. Responsible for Workers’ Compensation, Safety and LOA training and administration. 
 
Participated in the development of a competitive Compensation Program; Facilitate performance appraisal programs twice a year; Participate in Salary Surveys.  
 
Employee Relation Counselor, including interpreting company policies to management and employees. 
 
Program Managed employee merger and integration activities when Intel Corporation purchased company in late 1999. Regional Human Resources Manager Budget Rent a Car May 1993  –  May 1995  (2 years 1 month) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Responsibilities included company recruitment and benefit orientation; representing company in Unemployment Hearings, Arbitration & Mediation; acting as the Employee Relation Counselor, provide assistance to managers dealing with employee disciplinary action; Conduct Exit Interviews; Implement Safety Program; Monitored Workers’ Compensation, ADA and AAP policies and plans. Summary An Intel Corporation leader with 20+ years of service, I love building things. Teams. Factories. Organizations. People. I believe in continual improvement, not only of ourselves, but of the people around us, the work that we do and the environment in which we do it. I've lived and worked in 3 countries and explored countless others and believe in the fundamental goodness of people and our ability as a human race to overcome any obstacle or challenge. Experience Human Resource Manager Intel Corporation March 2012  – Present (3 years 6 months) Hillsboro, OR Back to headquarters! I now manage an HR Business Partner team based in Oregon. We focus on Organizational Assessment, Complex Change and Transition Management, Leader Development and Leadership Pipeline Development and Strategic Workforce Planning. We work closely with other Business HR teams focusing on Internal Consulting and Employee Engagement, and often work on teams with Intel's Talent Organization, Compensation and Development Organization, and the Executive Development Team. Director, Vietnam Human Resources, Intel Corporation April 2009  –  March 2012  (3 years) Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam Reporting to Regional Managing Director of Human Resources, Responsible for all aspects of Human Resources for Intel's operations in Vietnam including a greenfield factory startup of the company's largest assembly and test facility on the planet. Director, Chengdu, PRC Human Resources Intel Corporation October 2007  –  March 2009  (1 year 6 months) Chengdu, Sichuan, China Reporting to PRC Human Resources Director, responsible for all aspects of Human Resources at Intel's Chengdu site including the startup of a second factory at the site and doubling the site headcount in 15 months. Also led Sichuan Earthquake Recovery following the 8.0 magnitude earthquake that occured ~50 miles from Intel and received Intel's highest level of internal recognition for the work. Human Resources Manager, Research and Development Intel Corporation January 2004  –  October 2007  (3 years 10 months) Reporting to the Manufacturing and Technology Development HR Manager, responsible for all aspects of Human Resource Management for an Arizona, Malaysia and China based R&D group. Senior Recruiter Intel Corporation 2000  –  2004  (4 years) Chandler, AZ Campus Recruiting Manager/ Business Recruiting Consultant- search, screening & selection of top University talent at Tier 1 and Tier 2 MBA schools throughout the US, as well as search, screening & selection of top PhD talent from leading research universities. Operations Manager Intel Corporation 1999  –  2000  (1 year) Chandler, AZ I supervised teams of 15-30 Manufacturing and Test Technicians in a 24*7 wafer fabrication environment including Test, Surface Mount and Lithography. I was responsible for all aspects of safety, quality and operations excellence for my team and functional area Shift Coordinator/Shift Manager Intel Corporation 1994  –  1998  (4 years) Chandler, AZ I was responsible for managing teams of 20-60 Manufacturing Technicians in a 24x7 Electronics Assembly and Test Factory Environment including the Safety, Quality and Operational Excellence of my team and functional area. Manufacturing Technician Intel Corporation 1992  –  1994  (2 years) Chandler, AZ Responsible for the safe, high-quality assembly of Intel Products on the factory floor.
